PAD_AstarionsComment.synopsis: Astarion's comment after we finish talking to Ketheric and he told us to kneel at the altar.
PAD_AstarionsComment.how_to_trigger: Have Astarion-Companion in party.Talk to Ketheric.

AD_Execution.synopsis: Ketheric's AD before the execution. Bitter vitriol in his voice.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: Based on the provided synopses, 'AD_Execution' involves Ketheric's dialogue just before an execution, delivering bitter vitriol. 'PAD_AstarionsComment' is Astarion's comment after speaking with Ketheric, particularly after being told to kneel at the altar. This clearly implies that the interaction in 'AD_Execution' (with Ketheric) must occur before the moment when Astarion provides his comment. There are no indications of any mutually exclusive (exclusive) constraints between these sessions.

PAD_AstarionsComment_0.speaker: Astarion
PAD_AstarionsComment_0.text: Finally. Time to see the one controlling these parasites.

PAD_AstarionsComment_1.speaker: Astarion
PAD_AstarionsComment_1.text: Maybe they can be controlled just as easily.

AD_Execution_0.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
AD_Execution_0.text: Considering all that is at stake...

AD_Execution_3.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
AD_Execution_3.text: Considering how close we are to the conclusion of our efforts...

AD_Execution_1.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
AD_Execution_1.text: I ask you again: why am I here?
AD_Execution_1.context: NodeContext: Bitter vitriol in his voice.
